title: Modernity's Dead-End is a Religious Wall
description:
Andrew Root notes on Paul Anlietner's podcast that the Mainline church has hit a wall. The clergy no longer has any role in the modern world. How did this happen? 



We'll follow the Charles Taylor/Max Weber analysis of secularity all the way up to Sam Harris and Bret Weinstein. Basically if you guy the anthropology of blind Darwinian evolution of the genetic and culture track we wind up with Sam Harris' patch. The same science that tells us we must have religion to experience meaning and purpose tells us that all religion is a mind trick, a trick of perception. Where do we go from here? 

2:06 - Accountability timestamp
2:18 - Ancient Technology Clip 
5:04 - Evolution of Spiritual Politics
7:37 - Story of the Bible
8:45 - Deism Sammich
13:13 - Darwin comes along
16:34 - Purpose in Priestcraft
17:53 - Myth of Progress
20:44 - Cultural Telomeres (when he sees it)
22:24 - totally not snark - 
24:11 - 19th century philosophy
25:15 - yon Pastoral Sword - 
27:38 - kindler gentler idea economy
30:11 - Hurry Up Andrea
31:25 - Veil of Forgetting
31:38 - it's pronounced the other way
32:33 - pattern monkeying - 
34:52 - hermeneutics of suspicion
38:12 - Vanderklay's way of saying LARP
40:13 - the root of it
41:01 - Gambler Karaoke
42:05 - that's my point
42:45 - insert caption
44:55 - LARP with feeling
49:35 - 5 blind guys and an elephant
52:11 - Seeking Sacred
